newsitem.title: USA: Trimedyne to appeal decision in patent lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Trimedyne to appeal decision in patent lawsuit.

text.p: Trimedyne Inc Wednesday said it plans to appeal decisions made by the Federal Court in Orange County, Calif., in Trimedyne's patent infringement lawsuit against Surgical Laser Technologies.

In a statement, the company said it will appeal the court's decisions on U.S. Patent No. 4,733,413, covering contact laser surgery devices, and U.S. Patent No. 5,380,317, covering sidefiring laser devices to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia or BPH, a condition affecting an estimated 50 percent of men over age 55.
Trimedyne's sidefiring laser devices are the only laser products cleared for marketing by the U.S. FDA for the treatment of BPH, the company said.
